subject: Re: Migrating Junit 4.10 to 3.8.1
msgSnippet: Marvin thank you for your answer. It gave me a different viewpoint of how to manage Exceptions, might be able to use it on my next assignment. I Appreciate
messageBody:
Marvin thank you for your answer. It gave me a different viewpoint of how to manage Exceptions, might be able to use it on my next assignment.
I Appreciate everyones willingness to fulfill my doubts.
Regards, Sabrina.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "MarvinToll.com" <MarvinToll@...> wrote:
>
> Sabrina,
> Here is a utility class that has an "assertException" method.
>
> http://www.patternenabled.com/source/xref/info/soaj/core/testing/internal/TestCoreUtil.html
>
> Here is an example invocation:
>
> http://patternenabled.com/source/xref-test/info/soaj/core/timer/PiTimerTest.html
>
> (See the public void testPlugins_notActive() method.)
>
> --------------------
>
> Rest assured that not everyone automatically thinks the latest release of a technology is the "best" alternative... or that an exuberance for injection demands attention.
>
> http://wp.me/P1FU3L-cl
>
>
> _Marvin
> PatternEnabled.com
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@> wrote:
> >
> > Sabrina,
> >
> > Yes, using try/catch to test exceptions is a common pattern in JUnit 3.
> >
>
